Confidential Information This document is confidential to Infosys limited. This document contains information and data that Infosys considers confidential and proprietary (“Confidential Information”). Confidential Information includes, but is not limited to, the following: Corporate, employee and infrastructure information about Infosys Infosys’ project management and quality processes Customer and project experiences provided to illustrate Infosys capability Any disclosure of Confidential Information to, or use of it by a third party will be damaging to Infosys. Ownership of all Confidential Information, no matter in what media it resides, remains with Infosys. Confidential Information in this document shall not be disclosed and shall not be duplicated, used, or disclosed – in whole or in part – for any purpose other than for ESM Café implementations without specific written permission of an authorized representative of Infosys. © 2011- 2015 Infosys Limited, Bangalore, India. All Rights Reserved. Infosys believes the information in this document is accurate as of its publication date; such information is subject to change without notice. Infosys acknowledges the proprietary rights of other companies to the trademarks, product names and such other intellectual property rights mentioned in this document. Except as expressly permitted, neither this documentation nor any part of it may be reproduced, stored in a retrieval system, or transmitted in any form or by any means, electronic, mechanical, printing, photocopying, recording or otherwise, without the prior permission of Infosys Limited and/or any named intellectual property rights holders under this document.

Business Requirements Specification 6 2.1 Data fields (Incident Form) 6 2.2 Integration with CMDB 10 2.3 Notifications 11 2.4 Queue Management 11 2.5 Reporting and Dashboard 12 2.6 Incident Lifecycle and Generic Requirements 13 2.7 Surveys 17 2.8 SLA 17

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

1. Overview

1.1 Purpose of the Document

The purpose of this document is intended to provide an overview of the Incident Management process as a reference to clearly understand the standards and procedures put in place to manage the Incident lifecycle. This document covers the detailed business requirements implemented in Infosys’ ESM Café Service Now (ServiceNow Gold Image) tool.

1.2 Scope of the Incident Management Process

Incident Management includes any event which disrupts or which could disrupt a service. This includes events which are communicated directly by users, either through the Service Desk or through an interface from Event Management to Incident Management tools.

Key activities within the Incident Management Process are:

· Incident investigation, handling and closure.

· Management of interactions regarding critical losses of service.

1.3 Benefits of the Incident Management Process

The benefits of the Incident Management Process are:

· Consistency in service levels

· Increased quality of service and faster turnaround on incidents.

· Improved teamwork and communication at all levels of IT

· A reduction of telephone calls to the Service Desk

· Improved customer satisfaction

· Increased efficiency in the usage of IT resources

· Increased productivity overall.

· Better IT governance for leadership.

2. Business Requirements Specification

This section is intended to provide an overview of the Incident Management business requirements specifications and to be used as a reference to clearly understand the standards and procedures put in place to manage Incident Management on the ESM Café platform.

2.1 Data fields (Incident Form)

Business Requirement Number

Description

IM 1001

The Incident Management team should be able to create the incident ticket by capturing the following information:

· Number (OOB)

· Opened (ESM)-(is already available)

· Caller (OOB, Edit and search option enabled), can it be renamed to Opened for (ESM)/ custom field

· Opened by (OOB)

· Location (ESM) is OOB

· Contact Type (OOB)

· Preferred contact (ESM, Edit option enabled. Email (OOB) or phone (ESM)) – same requirement to be added to portal – create incident

· Category (OOB)

· Sub Category (OOB)

· Parent incident (OOB)

· Configuration Item (OOB)

· State (OOB with ESM states and validation)

· Assignment group (OOB)

· Assigned to (OOB)

· Impact (OOB field, OOB dropdown)

· Urgency (OOB field, OOB drop down)

· Priority (OOB, Non editable field - determined by Impact and Urgency)

· Short description (OOB)

· Description (OOB)

· Problem (OOB)

· Reassignment count (OOB)

· Vendor Ticket number (ESM)

· Vendor name (ESM)

· Time worked (OOB)

· Reopen count (OOB) (check validation)

· Caused by change (OOB)

· Missing CI (ESM, Check box field)

· Additional comment (OOB)

· Work notes (OOB)

· VIP flag (Flag enabled for users listed as VIP in the tool)

IM 1002 (ESM)

Missing CI as a checkbox

On clicking the checkbox the following fields will appear:-

· Missing CI Name (Editable text field)

· CI description (Not in the system)

On submission of Incident a request is created and assigned to configuration manager (group)

This request is independent of incident closure and can be seen on the related list

IM 1003 (ESM)

Location auto populated on selection of a value in “Opened For” field as

well as VIP if information is available (flag). Notification should be sent to the Incident Manager once the flag is checked.

IM 1004 (ESM)

Problem candidate flag/ checkbox on the incident form.

On checking it the ticket should also be visible in the Problem application in the module ” Potential problem Candidate”

IM 1005 (ESM)

State Values

Following are the states during the lifecycle of the incident

· New (This is the default state when a new incident is created)

· Assigned (This is the state when the incident is assigned to an individual)-ESM

· In Progress (This is the state when Incident analyst starts working on the ticket)

· On Hold (This state is selected when incident is awaiting inputs). On selecting this option, selection of one of the below subcategory is mandatory.

· Awaiting caller

· Awaiting Change

· Awaiting vendor

· Awaiting Problem

(For Awaiting Change – mandatory to have a change number linked, For Awaiting vendor, vendor fields are mandatory, For Awaiting Problem, Problem field become mandatory)

Resolved (This state is selected when incident is resolved)

Closed (This state is not selectable value by IT Support Staff. It is dependent on user accepting the resolution or system policy)

Canceled-OOB-All fields will be read only after that

 

IM 1006 (ESM)

· Auto population of priority based on Impact & Urgency of service.

Impact

Urgency

Priority

1 High

1 High

1 Critical

1 High

2 Medium

2 High

1 High

3 Low

3 Moderate

2 Medium

1 High

1 High

2 Medium

2 Medium

3 Moderate

2 Medium

3 Low

4 Low

3 Low

1 High

3 Moderate

3 Low

2 Medium

4 Low

3 Low

3 Low

5 Planning

Impact Classification: 1 –High, 2 – Medium, 3-Low

Urgency Classification: 1 – High; 2 –Medium , 3- Low

NOTE: When Urgency or Impact fields are updated, the Work Notes Field becomes mandatory upon change. Please ensure to enter the Work Notes comment before you click save button.

State changes flow

2.2 Integration with CMDB

Business Requirement Number

Description

IM 2001 (OOB)

IM will support the addition of one or multiple CIs affected by the incident

IM 2002 (OOB)

The Affected CI will show the BSM Map functionality to allocate/find related incidents based on the Configuration Item. If a CI is attached to an incident.

IM 2003 (ESM)

BSM Map functionality to allocate/find related incidents based on the Configuration Item.

Related list of open Incidents for same configuration item

 

2.3 Notifications

Business Requirement Number

Description

IM 3001 (ESM)

 

 

Notifications

Notifications must occur throughout the lifecycle of an Incident. The tool must support common notifications such as when a record has been assigned to a group or individual. Additionally, ad hoc notifications must also be supported to allow an analyst or manager to alert appropriate stakeholders from within the context of the Incident record. Refer to Notifications table for specific requirements

 

2.4 Queue Management

Business Requirement Number

Description

IM 4001 (ESM)

Queue Management

A user should be able to view all ‘In Progress’ state incident tickets assigned to his/her primary group under “In Progress” module.

A user should be able to view all ‘Assigned to me’ incident tickets assigned to a particular individual

A user should be able to view all ‘open’ state incident tickets assigned to his/her primary group under “open” & “open –unassigned “module

A user should be able to view all ‘On-Hold state incident tickets assigned to his/her primary group under “On-Hold” module.

A user should be able to view all ‘Resolved’ sate incident tickets assigned to his/her primary group under “Resolved” Module.

A user should be able to view all incident tickets assigned to his/her primary group under “My Group work”

A user should be able to view all incident tickets assigned to him/her under “My Work”

A user should be able to view all incident tasks assigned to his/her group under “Tasks Assigned to My Group”

A user should be able to view all incident tasks assigned to him/her under “Tasks Assigned to me”

2.5 Reporting and Dashboard

Business Requirement Number

 

Description

IM 5001 (ESM)

ESM Café Incident Volume- Category/Sub-Category Last 90 days

IM 5002 (ESM)

Open and Closed Incidents – Priority wise

IM 5003 (ESM)

ESM Café Incident Ageing Report

IM 5004 (ESM)

ESM Cafe Incidents First call resolution - Last Month

IM 5005 (ESM)

ESM Cafe Top incidents by Configuration items- last 30 days

IM 5006 (ESM)

Incidents by resolution code/Closure code – last month

ESM Café Incidents by SLA status Last Month

IM 5007 (ESM)

ESM Café CSAT Report –User Satisfaction Survey

2.6 Incident Lifecycle and Generic Requirements

· Incident Lifecycle Management: Requirements related to Incident creation, categorization, prioritization, investigation & diagnosis and resolution, viewing and searching incidents, by the Incident Management team.

Business Requirement Number

‘Description

IM 6001 (ESM)

Every Incident number should be unique, non-editable and auto-generated

IM 6002 (ESM)

Incident State should Automatically change to “Assigned” when ticket is Assigned to “Assignee” for the first time.

IM 6003 (ESM)

Parent/Child Incident

Incident Management team should be able to link parent and child incidents in one is many relationship by

· Selecting the Parent Incident on the child record

· By creating the child incident from the Parent record or

 

The fields that are copied from the parent incident to the child Incident when agent clicks on “Create Child Incident” and the fields should be editable.

· Priority

· Configuration Item

· Category

· Subcategory

· Configuration item

· Assignment group

· Short Description

· Description

· Parent Incident (number)

 

Parent field lookup list will not show the following Incidents:

· Resolved

· Closed

· Child of other Incidents

 

On submission/ save the child incident should be visible in the related list of parent incident

 

Existing Incident can be added as child from the related list on the parent Incident

Child field lookup list will not show the following Incidents:

· Resolved

· Closed

· Child of other Incidents

IM 6004 (ESM)

Parent/Child Incident

Changes made to the Parent incident will be reflected to the related child incidents like Status(detailed on requirement 4),

Additional Comments, Work notes, Resolution Note, Resolution. Also, any knowledge Article attached to parent incident will be copied to child Incidents also.

Parent State

On Hold Reason (Parent)

Child State

On Hold Reason (Child)

On Hold

Awaiting Change/Awaiting Problem/Awaiting Vendor

Same as parent

Same as parent

On Hold

Awaiting caller

Not updated

Not updated

In Queue

NA

Same as parent

 

Work In Progress

NA

Same as parent

 

Resolved

NA

Resolved.

NA

Activity log on child incidents should be updated to Resolution notes copied from Parent Incident.

Closed

NA

Not closed.

NA

Child incidents must always be closed by the caller or by the system based on the auto closure property.

Canceled

NA

NA

NA

 

When parent Incident is reopened, child incidents will not be automatically reopened. Child Incidents can be manually opened by agent.

 

IM 6005 (OOB)

Incident Tasks

The Incident Management team should be able to create incident tasks within the incident record.

All incident tasks need to be closed before an Incident is resolved

If you try to resolve an incident but if there are any Open or Work in Progress or Pending Incident Tasks associated it, then it will ask you close all the incident tasks. After that only you can able to restore a incident

Incident task should capture the Configuration Item(Optional) information

Incident task should have the following status codes during its lifecycle

· Open

· Work in Progress

· Pending

· Closed incomplete

· Closed complete

Note: Incident task will not have SLA attached.

IM 6006 (ESM)

Incident Resolution and Closure

System should provide the capability to capture the following information at the time of incident resolution: (State is Resolved)

· Resolution Code

· Resolution Notes

· Resolved time

· Resolved by

7 days post incident resolution, the incident state will automatically change to “Closed”

System should also be able to capture the following information

· Closed

· Closed by

Incident will become read only when it is closed.

IM 6007 (ESM)

Reopening an Incident

There should be an “Reopen” link with in the notification sent to users when incident is resolved, which should allow users to reopen the incident and assign it to the same assignee to whom it was last assigned to

The system should calculate the number of times an incident has been reopened.

IM 6008 (OOB)

Reassignment Counter

A reassignment counter field should be available on the incident form that will give the count of total reassignments of the ticket.

Every time assignment group changes, the Reassignment Counter value should increase by one.

IM 6009 (OOB)

Incidents in On Hold State

An ITIL User should be able to change the state of the incident to ‘On Hold state only for an incident in “In progress’ state.

The state is changed to “On Hold” when the incident needs to await inputs from customer or a change implementation or pending vendor inputs.

When the state is selected as ‘On-hold’, a mandatory field called Pending Reason should be available to provide the reasons. The reasons should be –

· Awaiting User

· Awaiting Vendor

· Awaiting Change request

· Awaiting Problem

When in “Awaiting User” system will send 3 reminders to the user for providing inputs. After 8 days ticket will auto-close.

SLA clock should be stopped on all “Awaiting condition”.

IM 6010 (ESM)

Incident Withdraw

-System should provide the option of withdraw the Incident to the Requestor/ Caller -On clicking ‘Withdraw’ button the incident should get closed and the state changes to “Cancelled”.

- When a user clicks the “withdraw” button the activity logs should also be update with “ withdrawn by <opened for/ Caller >

- Service desk users should have access to withdraw Incidents.

IM 6011 (ESM)

Incident by same caller

When Service Desk opens the ticket, system should show all the tickets for the same caller.

IM 6012 (OOTB)

Association of Problem and Change Record

 

ITIL user should be able to associate Incident record with Problem and Change records.

 

Related list of Problem and Change should be visible on Incident page

IM 6013 (OOB)

 

Creation of Change from Incidents

 

ITIL user should be able to create Change record from Incidents. These records should be linked to the Incident.

 

System should create a normal change request and short description should be copied from the Incident.

 

IM6014 (OOB)

Add the Request related list

Request tab is added in the Related link. It becomes easier to attach a related request item to the incident.

IM6015 (ESM)

Preferred Contact

Make Preferred Contact field drop-down with values as Email and Phone and mandatory

Email and phone fields should auto populate and editable based on opened for

Email Or Phone fields will be mandatory based on Preferred contact option

IM6016 (ESM)

Auto Problem Creation

If Problem Candidate is checked in an Incident form, the incident is added in the list Potential problem candidates. The incidents in that list should have the same context menu as in normal incident form.

Whenever a problem is created from incident using Create problem the following fields from Incident should be copied to Problem from the incident form:

· Opened By

· Priority

· Category

· Sub category

· Short Description

· Problem Description

 

IM6017 (ESM)

VIP User differentiation

If the “caller” is a “VIP User” in incident table, then the “opened for” field is highlighted in the list view using bold

IM6018 (ESM)

Additional Comments to be made mandatory if

· State is Awaiting Customer Response

· Priority is changed

· State is changed from Resolved to any other state

Also a notification will be triggered for the requester

IM6019 (ESM)

When incident is resolved; following fields should become read-only

Opened for

Impact

Urgency

Priority

Configuration Item

Category

Sub-category

Business Service

Assignment Group

Assigned to

IM6020 (OOTB)

System Audit

· All the fields on the Incident form should be audited with time stamp.

 

2.7 Surveys

Business Requirement Number

Description

IM 7001 (ESM)

The user survey should be sent through a notification after the state of the incident is changed to ‘Resolved’

Survey Criteria:

· A Business/End User should receive only one Survey notification only once a month

· Survey link should be sent in the email notification sent on Incident Resolution

· If the Business/End User doesn’t respond to a Survey, a reminder notification should be triggered after 3 days and another after 5 days

· System should provide the ability to send the Survey to random users

· System should provide ability to generate reports on Surveys

System should also provide an option to user for filling the survey on the Service Portal. The link will appear on the portal for 30 days.

2.8 SLA

Business Requirement Number

Description

IM 8001 (ESM)

 

· SLA will pause on “On hold” and “Resolved” state

· SLA will stop on “Cancelled” and “Closed” state.

· When the Incident is reopened then SLA clock will start where it was left earlier.

· Incorporate the US holiday calendar in the Schedule SLA.

SLAs to be cancelled if incident is cancelled

· If the incident is withdrawn the Response and Resolution SLAs should be cancelled. Currently the SLAs remain in In-Progress

· Once the incident is withdrawn, fields on the form become read-only

 

Priority

Response

Resolution

P1

30 mins

4hrs

P2

45 mins

24 hrs

P3

120 mins

5 days

P4

48 hrs

7 days

P5

--

--

 

 

Infosys Confidential
